results.name: Triangle read by rows, based on array described below.
comment: Form an array a(m,n) (n >= 1, 1 <= m <= n) by: a(1,n) = n^2 for all n; a(m+1,n) = (n-m)*floor( (a(m,n)-1)/(n-m) ) for 1 <= m <= n-1.
The interesting property of this array is that the main diagonal gives A000960.
link: H. Killingbergtro and C. U. Jensen, Problem 116, Nord. Mat. Tidskr. 5 (1957), 160-161.
mathematica: max = 11; a[1, n_] := n^2; a[m_, n_] /; 1 < m <= n := a[m, n] = (n-m+1)*Floor@((a[m-1, n] - 1)/(n-m+1)); a[_, _] = 0; t = Table[ a[m, n], {m, 1, max}, {n, m, max}]; Flatten[ Table[ t[[m-n+1, n]], {m, 1, max}, {n, 1, m}]] (* _Jean-François Alcover_, Feb 21 2012 *)
xref: Cf. A000960, A100453. Row 1 = squares, row 2 = squares - 1, row 3 = A100451. Column sums give A100454.
